org.springframework.core

?? Ordered

  • ???????:
    PriorityOrdered

    public interface Ordered
    Ordered is an interface that can be implemented by objects that should be orderable, for example in a Collection.

    The actual order can be interpreted as prioritization, with the first object (with the lowest order value) having the highest priority.

    Note that there is also a priority marker for this interface: PriorityOrdered. Order values expressed by PriorityOrdered objects always apply before same order values expressed by plain Ordered objects.

    Consult the Javadoc for OrderComparator for details on the sort semantics for non-ordered objects.

    ???????:
    07.04.2003
    ??:
    Juergen Hoeller, Sam Brannen
    ????:
    PriorityOrdered, OrderComparator, Order, AnnotationAwareOrderComparator

        ????:
        Integer.MAX_VALUE, ?????

    • ??????

      • getOrder

        int getOrder()
        Get the order value of this object.

        Higher values are interpreted as lower priority. As a consequence, the object with the lowest value has the highest priority (somewhat analogous to Servlet load-on-startup values).

        Same order values will result in arbitrary sort positions for the affected objects.

        ??:
        the order value
        ????:
        HIGHEST_PRECEDENCE, LOWEST_PRECEDENCE
